2 ^ It is good to give praise to the Lor: 3 ^ to show forth thy mercy in the morning
and to sing to thy name: and thy truth in the night

2 ^ It is good to give praise to the Lor: 4 ^ upon an instrument of ten strings
O most High~;: with a canticle upon the harp.

column4: and in the works of thy hands I shall rejoice.

and to sing to thy name: O Lord. Thy thoughts are exceeding deep.

2 ^ It is good to give praise to the Lor: 7 ^ The senseless man shall not know
and to sing to thy name: nor will the fool understand these things.

2 ^ It is good to give praise to the Lor: 8 ^ When the wicked shall spring up as grass
and to sing to thy name: and all the workers of iniquity shall appear
O most High~;: that they may perish for ever and ever~;

2 ^ It is good to give praise to the Lor: 9 ^ but thou art the Most High for evermore

O most High~;: for behold thy enemies shall perish
column4: and all the workers of iniquity shall be scattered.

2 ^ It is good to give praise to the Lor: 11 ^ And my horn shall be exalted like that of the unicorn
and to sing to thy name: and my old age in plentiful mercy.

2 ^ It is good to give praise to the Lor: 12 ^ And my eye hath looked down upon my enemies
and to sing to thy name: and my ear shall hear of the downfall of the malignant that rise up against me.

2 ^ It is good to give praise to the Lor: 13 ^ The just shall flourish like the palm tree~; he shall grow up like the cedar of Lebanon.
14 ^ They that are planted in the house of the Lord
and to sing to thy name: in the courts of the house of our God they shall flourish.

2 ^ It is good to give praise to the Lor: 15 ^ They shall still increase in a fruitful old age
16 ^ that they may show that the Lord our God is righteous
and to sing to thy name: and there is no iniquity in him.
